intro: Pseudobombax ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic ceiba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, red bracts that surround its yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in humid, lowland areas and is often found in forested regions. Its striking appearance makes it a notable ornamental and ecological species in its native habitat.
